intro: Pecluma recurvata, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb with upright, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas. Pecluma recurvata is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
